critique: The document establishes an official bulletin board for the National Recovery Administration (NRA) to provide public notice of hearings and proceedings related to the National Industrial Recovery Act. This suggests a move towards greater government intervention in the economy and industry, as the NRA was a key component of Roosevelt's New Deal policies aimed at regulating and coordinating economic activity during the Great Depression. The order also centralizes authority by establishing a federal bulletin board in Washington D.C. for disseminating information.
